Safety Rules.title: When to Lock a Single Blade

General Rules at Service Check.title: Tightening Torque Rules for V47-500/600 kW
Lubrication Rules and General check for V47-500/600 KW

Fall Protection System.title: Check presence of anchor point for wire rope in top and bottom of tower
Check condition of wire Shackles and shackle lock (No loose, rust free)
Check smooth sliding of wire guides on the ladder. Check tightness of all bolt connections.

Anchor Points.title: Check proper tightness of anchor point for wire rope in top and bottom of tower

Nose Cone.title: Check bolts at nose cone support for proper tightness. (M20 Torque 477 NM)
Check tightness of bolts available in nose cone. (M8 bolts 20 NM)
Check nose cone for no cracks.
Check welding joints properly on nose cone support. No rust or No cracks

Blades.title: Inspect the blades 1 Free from dirty
Inspect the blades 2 Free from dirty
Inspect the blades 3 Free from dirty
Check every 3rd of the 60 M20 bolts for blade and blade bearing (Torque 320 NM - Annual)
Check every 10th of the 60 M20 bolts for blade and blade bearing (Torque 320 NM - Half Yearly)
Check for no cracks throughout the blade please mention blade No (if any)

Hub and Blade Bearing.title: Check every 3rd of the 60 M20 bolts for BLADE 1 bearing and hub (Torque 320 NM - Annual)
Check every 3rd of the 60 M20 bolts for BLADE 2 bearing and hub (Torque 320 NM - Annual)
Check every 3rd of the 60 M20 bolts for BLADE 3 bearing and hub (Torque 320 NM - Annual)
Check every 10th of the 60 M20 bolts for BLADE 1 bearing and hub (Torque 320 NM - Half Yearly)
Check every 10th of the 60 M20 bolts for BLADE 2 bearing and hub (Torque 320 NM - Half Yearly)
Check every 10th of the 60 M20 bolts for BLADE 3 bearing and hub (Torque 320 NM - Half Yearly)
Lubricate blade -1 bearing. Lubricate bearing / 400 Gms (Rhodina BBZ /LGBB2/Mobil SHC 460)
Lubricate blade -2 bearing. Lubricate /bearing 400 Gms (Rhodina BBZ/LGBB2/Mobil SHC 460)
Lubricate blade -3 bearing. Lubricate /bearing 400 Gms (Rhodina BBZ/LGBB2/Mobil SHC 460)
Check Lip seal condition and check for no grease leakage - BLADE 1
Check Lip seal condition and check for no grease leakage - BLADE 2
Check Lip seal condition and check for no grease leakage - BLADE 3
Lubricate traverse holder front bushing and traverse holder. ( SKF LGWM1 - 100 Gms)

Main Bearing Housing.title: Check lip seal for no leakage in bearing - FRONT
Check lip seal for no leakage in bearing - REAR
Check availability of Grease collecting Tray - FRONT
Check availability of Grease collecting Tray - REAR
Collect Main bearing Grease samples - FRONT
Collect Main bearing Grease samples - REAR
Lubricate Bearing - SKF LGWM1 Grease / Kluberplex BEM 41-141 (400 Gms / bearing) ( Ensure RPM should be 200 to 300) - FRONT
Lubricate Bearing - SKF LGWM1 Grease / Kluberplex BEM 41-141 (400 Gms / bearing) ( Ensure RPM should be 200 to 300) - REAR
Check for vibration / abnormality observed from bearing - FRONT
Check for vibration / abnormality observed from bearing - REAR
Check availability of Main bearing cover - FRONT
Check availability of Main bearing cover - REAR

Soft Braking.title: Check healthiness of Batteries (Replace voltage below 8 Volt)
Check charger working condition, output :27.1 V DC

Cable Switches.title: Check cable conditions for no cracks - HYDRAULIC
Check cable conditions for no cracks - LOW SPEED
Check cable conditions for no cracks - HIGH SPEED
Check cable conditions for no cracks - CW
Check cable conditions for no cracks - CCW
Check cable conditions for no cracks - NACELLE COOLING
Check availability of cable gland at Motor Terminal Box - HYDRAULIC
Check availability of cable gland at Motor Terminal Box - LOW SPEED
Check availability of cable gland at Motor Terminal Box - HIGH SPEED
Check availability of cable gland at Motor Terminal Box - CW
Check availability of cable gland at Motor Terminal Box - CCW
Check availability of cable gland at Motor Terminal Box - NACELLE COOLING
Check tightness and healthiness of Emergency switches and its Cables - YAW PLATE
Check tightness and healthiness of Emergency switches and its Cables - MAIN BEARING
Check tightness and healthiness of Emergency switches and its Cables - TOP CONTROL PANEL
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - BEARING
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - AMBIENT
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - NACELLE
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - TOP CONTROL PANEL
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - GEAR OIL
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - HYDRAULIC OIL
Check for no loose connections on Temperature sensors - GENERATOR WINDING
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - SAFETY BLOCK
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - TOP CONTROL PANEL
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - HYDRAULIC MOTOR
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - CW MOTOR
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - CCW MOTOR
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - GEAR OIL COOLER MOTOR
Ensure tightness of Earthing Connections - NACELLE COOLING MOTOR

Traverse Connecting Rod.title: Check tightness of M12 bolts in traverse cover (Torque Value : 70 Nm, Bolt Size 18 or 19)
Check tightness of M20 bolts in cranks (Torque Value 320 NM)
Check tightness of M20 bolts to connecting rods (Torque Value 320 NM)
Check tightness of M10 bolts in retaining plates (Anti Rotation tube sliding shoes & tube 16 Bolts, Torque Value 41 NM)
Check clearance of bearing in connecting rod to traverse during Emergency Mode (Max play: 0.75 mm) BLADE 1
Check clearance of bearing in connecting rod to traverse during Emergency Mode (Max play: 0.75 mm) BLADE 2
Check clearance of bearing in connecting rod to traverse during Emergency Mode (Max play: 0.75 mm) BLADE 3
Check clearance of bearing in connecting rod to traverse during Emergency Mode (Max play: 0.30 mm) BLADE 1
Check clearance of bearing in connecting rod to traverse during Emergency Mode (Max play: 0.30 mm) BLADE 2
Check clearance of bearing in connecting rod to traverse during Emergency Mode (Max play: 0.30 mm) BLADE 3
Check clearance between glycoder bushing and traverse holder (Max play 0.5 mm)
Presence of chrome layer on traverse holder
Check physical appearance of sliding surface on antirotation tube
Check visual end play in anti-rotation tube
Lubricate bearings in crank connecting rod wherever applicable (SKF LGEWM1 - 5 Gms)
Lubricate bearings in traverse connecting rod wherever applicable (SKF LGWM1 - 5 Gms)

Pitch System.title: Check tightness of M16 bolts in bearing house to hydraulic cylinder (Cylinder mounting 24 bolts) - Torque 180 NM
Check tightness of push rod through gear box (Use 41 spanner during pause mode)
Check clearance between pitch bearing and push rod measure play max 0.05mm (Pitch Bearing push rod Play)
Check play in bearing and KM-nut. Max play 0.05mm (Push rod 46 Nut Play)
Check availability of guide rings in pitch bearing upper cover. Minimum clearance 4 mm between housing and guide ring
Measure plain bearing clearance on pitch cylinder piston rod. Max play: 0.20 mm
Measure clearance in angular contact plain bearing on cylinder mounting and check alignment of hydraulic cylinder. Play: Max 0.20 mm Min 0.05mm.
Check hydraulic pitch cylinder for no leakage 79.7° - 80.3°
Check hydraulic pitch cylinder for no leakage 9.7 ° - 10.3°
Check hydraulic pitch cylinder for no leakage 0.3° - 3.0°
Check piston rod for no damage
Check cylinder hoses for no leakage
Lubricate guide rings on pitch bearing upper cover and slide-rail to anti rotation device (SKF LGWM1 - 10 Gms)
Lubricate link head bearing on piston rod ( SKF LGWM1 - 5 Gms)
Lubricate hydraulic cylinder mounting (SKF LGWM1 - 10 Gms)

Gearbox.title: Check oil level at stand still
Check for no oil Leakage from level Glass
Check for no oil leakage in gear box
Check any metal deposits Magnetic Stand
Check Tightness of Spot bolts in bearing covers (Intermediate / High Speed / Low Speed - Torque 70 NM)
Replace air filter / replace breather wherever required
Check feedback signal of low gear oil pressure sensor during 750 RPM for Metso & Moventas , 1200 RPM for Jake gear box
Check Gear stay suspensor during apply of manual emergency push button at 200 RPM
Check visual condition of bolt between fork and bushing
Lubricate between Gear Stay Springs (Tribol GR 1350-2.5 PD 300 Gms)
Check tightness of Distance bush M16 bolts (Torque - 180 NM)

Composite Coupling - Nu-Tech Coupling.title: Check for no cracks on fibre disc
Check condition of knurling and its contacting area on coupling
Check Tightness of M10 bolts (16 bolts) Torque 54 NM
Check condition of vibration arrestor contacting with coupling
Check tightness of M16 bolts (Coupling 24 Bolts - Torque 180 NM)
Check availability and condition of brake disc outer cover
Check tightness of RPM sensor pick-up plate (Torque 8 NM )
Check tightness of RPM sensor & sensor cable stripping arrangements
Check tightness of cables at Terminal box under coupling
Check condition of rubber arms in flanges and coupling tube
Check tightness of coupling arm bolts in flanges and coupling tube (Torque 320 NM)

Gear Oil Cooling System.title: Check oil flow pressure at manifold block minimum 1 bar
Check for no leakage at radiator & its adaptors & Elbows
Check for no leakage at Hoses ( Inlet / Outlet)
Check oil flow pressure at Radiator Minimum 1 bar
Check for no leakage from Gear box inspection cover

Brake.title: Check for no leakage in calipers - RIGHT
Check for no leakage in calipers - TOP
Check for no leakage in calipers - LEFT
Check for no leakage from hoses and adaptors, air lock nipple, dummy at calipers - RIGHT
Check for no leakage from hoses and adaptors, air lock nipple, dummy at calipers - TOP
Check for no leakage from hoses and adaptors, air lock nipple, dummy at calipers - LEFT
Release air lock at callipers - TOP
Release air lock at callipers - LEFT
Check for no thermal heat at calipers and its brake pads during test run - RIGHT
Check for no thermal heat at calipers and its brake pads during test run - TOP
Check for no thermal heat at calipers and its brake pads during test run - LEFT
Check brake pad thickness at calipers and measure values - RIGHT
Check brake pad thickness at calipers and measure values - TOP
Check brake pad thickness at calipers and measure values - LEFT
Check for no cracks, brake pad lining marks on brake disc
Observe for no noise of brake pad (to be arrested after pick up to 1500 RPM)
Check healthiness of Brake Pad Sensor and its cable
Check tightness of cable at brake pad sensor and Terminal box

Generator.title: Check cable tightness in generator terminal box (Torque 49 NM)
Check cable condition inside terminal box
Check cable lugs physical condition No burnt marks
Observe noise of bearings DE or NDE or Both before Lubrication
Lubricate Drive End generator bearing (Kluberplex BEM 41-132 - 100 Gms)
Lubricate Non-Drive End generator bearing (Kluberplex BEM 41-132 - 100 Gms)
Observe noise of bearings DE or NDE or Both after lubrication
Check availability of Cable glands of power cables at generator terminal box
Check availability of cable stripping from platform to Terminal box
Check for no grease leakages from bearings DE or NDE or both
Check condition of front cover grill and cooling leaf
Check Earthing connection and tightness at Generator
Check tightness of M20 bolts (Damper Bolts - 180 NM)
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 1
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 2
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 3
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 4

Hydraulics.title: Check cable tightness in generator terminal box (Torque 49 NM)
Check cable condition inside terminal box
Check cable lugs physical condition No burnt marks
Observe noise of bearings DE or NDE or Both before Lubrication
Lubricate Drive End generator bearing (Kluberplex BEM 41-132 - 100 Gms)
Lubricate Non-Drive End generator bearing (Kluberplex BEM 41-132 - 100 Gms)
Observe noise of bearings DE or NDE or Both after lubrication
Check availability of Cable glands of power cables at generator terminal box
Check availability of cable stripping from platform to Terminal box
Check for no grease leakages from bearings DE or NDE or both
Check condition of front cover grill and cooling leaf
Check Earthing connection and tightness at Generator
Check tightness of M20 bolts (Damper Bolts - 180 NM)
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 1
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 2
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 3
Check clearance of Anti- Vibration mounting ( minimum 12 MM) Value 4

Yaw Gear - Yaw System.title: Observe noise of yaw drive motor vibrations when the turbine is yawing
Check oil level top up to maximum level
Check for no oil leakage from warm gear 2 stages of planetary gears
Check for yaw surface condition such as rust, grooves
Lubricate yaw grease nipple apply properly on yaw surface (Tribol GR 1350-2.5 PD to 400 Gms)
Check tightness of Nacelle ladder bolts M16 for stopper plate Gap should be between bolt and yaw surface (Torque 180 NM)
Check tightness of yaw stopper bolts Gap should be between bolt and yaw surface (Torque 180 NM)
Observe any vibration play during yawing
Apply 200 Gms Kluberplux AG 11 grease to Yaw teeth
Ensure Yaw sensor Twist sensor settings with power cable twist free Correct setting wherever required

Wind Vane, Anemometer.title: Check condition and function of wind vane and its cable adaptor
Check availability of wind vane counter
Check windvane function of turbine gets into run mode while out of service or checking wind direction during null wind or peak wind
Check condition and function of anemometer and its cable adaptor
Check the position of wind vane stand (5 degree tapper position should be for wind vane)
Check physical condition of wind vane stand and its supporting accessories

Nacelle Cover.title: Check visual condition of bolts, fittings and nacelle cover
Check condition of Nacelle damper for no cracks
Check working condition of closing mechanism and hinge for rear side door.
Check availability of safety chain at the rear side door.
Check availability of safety chain at the rear side door.
Check condition and healthiness of the outer roof rail
Check condition and healthiness of inner roof rail
Check availability and condition of Earthing connection between Nacelle top cover and Nacelle cover

Safety Items.title: Check availability & Healthiness of fire extinguisher
Check availability of First Aid box & top-up wherever required
Check physical condition of Power panel Mat

Lattice Tower.title: Check visual condition of bolts at assembly of corner irons
Check condition of Spot bolts at assembling of braces
Check tightness of bolts of ladder and landings
Check condition of Centre joint ladder
Check condition of power Cables at looping area outer sleeve / insulation damage
Check condition of all control supply cables outer sleeve / insulation damage at looping area including 690V and 230V
Check condition of Emergency Cable at looping area
Check availability of cables Rings from looping area to nacelle balcony area
Check availability of earth cable from Nacelle to Earth pit

Crane.title: Check working condition of sliding clutch with nominal load
Check condition of the chain for wear-free.
Check condition of suspension, crane block and load hook.
Check condition of electrical cables and connecting leads.
Check condition of Operating switch working at both directions

History of components replacements.title: Hyd Pump accessories with adaptor size
Nacelle Cooling motor with accessories Make
Gear oil pump flow rate LPM

Additional Points.title: Pitch bearing push rod area grease leakage
